The avian Syrinx was an evolutionarily impressive innovation.  The ancestors of birds and other sauropsids used to use a Larynx too but somewhere in the evolution of dinosaurs part of the structural cartilage supporting the airways was modified such that it could start producing sounds and it eventually took over vocal capabilities since it lacked the drawback of the Larynx from its original role which was to prevent choking and partially was lost to make sound. In summary a whole new organ was formed probably as some combination of benign genetic drift turned beneficial. It also as noted comes with the curious quirk that birds can make two different  sounds independently as they have a pair of vocal organs rather than a single one which is the defining characteristic of song birds.

Humans cannot make two sounds at once even with training, instead we make a single sound but adjust the resonance to bring out different parts of the harmonic series that comprise it. Birds on the other hand can make two unique sounds each with its own harmonic series within it.

Every time hank says song or sing in this video it should be replaced with language or talk. The assumption that what animals are doing here is not language is anthropocentric and its a problem that is endemic to linguistics. The amazing things these animals can communicate is proof that our assumptions should be reversed; we should assume animals have language and the burden of evidence should be on who wants to prove they don't

Toadfish are really underrated. They look ugly at first sight, but have extremely interesting physiology and behavior. They can sing extremely loudly for a fish, some are bioluminescence, most males provide parental care, and even have a morph of diminutive males that sneak-fertilise other broods. That's bird and cephalopod level of cool

I just watched the video. Wow, did you miss the point of your own video. I have watched other videos of yours and found them very informative in easy to understand language for B students like me. This video about Natures singers contained a sum total of 10-12 seconds of actual animal sound in an 11.38 minute video. If you are going to give examples of communication between two like examples, at least give us two examples. I watched an english video once about a famous drummer and his style. When the song example reached the drum solo the announcer explained in great detail about what was being played, but never for more than 1 second, let us here the solo. Less talking and more subject matter may just serve you better. Best of luck.
